thread.title: Fourth of July holiday happenings at the beach
thread.title_full: Fourth of July holiday happenings at the beach

author: Michelle Deal-Zimmerman
title: Fourth of July holiday happenings at the beach
text:
OC Beach Lights. On Sunday night, July 5, see an 8-minute laser light show that fills the sky with special effects, music and fireworks â€” all visible from the boardwalk. Show times are 9:30 p.m., 10 p.m. and 10:30 p.m. Free. 
DELAWARE BEACHES 
While the Cape May-Lewes Ferry fireworks cruise is sold out, other events are on tap. For the fireworks, consider using The Jolly Trolley, which runs from 8 a.m. to 2 a.m. Drop off/pickup is behind Jack Lingo Realtor at the Jolly Trolley Uptown Stop on Christian Street. 
Downtown Rehoboth Beach July Fourth Fireworks. Main Street's annual fireworks display along the beach and boardwalk in Rehoboth at 8:30 p.m. to 10 p.m. July 5. Fireworks will be launched from the beach in front of Star of the Sea, between Brooklyn Avenue and Laurel Street. The show, which starts at about 9:15 p.m. (weather permitting), is funded by the community and donations are welcome. 
Atlantic Sands Hotel "Rooftop Party." Enjoy open bar, awesome food and the best seat for the fireworks from 7:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. Limited tickets are still available for $70 per person. For more information, call 302-227-2511. 
66th Annual Cottage Tour of Art. The Rehoboth Art League presents a tour of seven homes and cottages of Rehoboth Beach, including this year the Homestead, a 1743 Colonial home listed on the National Registry of Historic Places. Tour starts at 10 a.m. July 7-8. Tickets are $30. Info: rehobothartleague.org
